title: New Data Suggests Public Losing Confidence That Fed Will Lower Inflation
sub_head: University of Michigan sentiment survey shows a jump in long-term inflation expectations
body:
Longer-term inflation expectations jumped in June, raising new fears that the Federal Reserve may be losing control over price pressures.
On Friday, the University of Michigan consumer sentiment survey said that the publicâ€™s expectation of inflation five years from now jumped to a reading of 3.3% from 3% in May. That was the first increase since January. Expected inflation a year from now also ticked up, hitting 5.4%, versus 5.3% in May.
